thread.title: Real Madrid news: Cristiano Ronaldo stats show he's changing his game | Metro News
thread.title_full: Real Madrid news: Cristiano Ronaldo stats show he's changing his game | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Real Madrid news: Cristiano Ronaldo stats show he's changing his game | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 3:55 pm Cristiano Ronaldo is not scoring at the rate we’ve become used to (Picture: Getty) 
Cristiano Ronaldo is showing that he can alter his game with age as stats suggest he’s dealing with becoming less of a goalscorer by creating more than in recent years. Paul Pogba shows brotherly love after Florentin is forced off injured 
The Real Madrid and former Manchester United star is one of the most deadly finishers of the modern era with an incredible 508 goals in 700 club career appearances, but is struggling to find the back of the net in the Champions League this term. 
Incredibly, Ronaldo has just two strikes to his name in the competition this season, despite having finished as top scorer in the previous four campaigns in a row. Ronaldo is now 523 minutes without a Champions League goal (Picture: Getty) 
Still, he’s now 523 minutes without scoring in the Champions League, which is the longest drought of his career at this level, though he has also set another record. Ronaldo CL goal tallies
